notes.completeness: 100% — all 7 MUST constraints present: format validation, disposable detection, normalization, DNS/MX, structured result, IDN support, detailed errors
notes.purity: 50% — 8/16 functions map directly to intent keywords. Core: validate, _split, _validate_local, _validate_domain, _check_mx, ValidationResult.__str__, DISPOSABLE_DOMAINS lookup. Non-pure: __init__ (x2), ValidationStatus members, ValidationResult dataclass fields.
notes.semantic_alignment: LLM: code correctly captures RFC 5322 email validation semantics with normalization pipeline

notes.constraint_saturation: 90% — all 7 constraints satisfied. Full RFC 5322 compliance, disposable frozenset, IDNA normalization, optional DNS with dnspython fallback.
notes.alternative_delta: 60.0 — LLM found a simpler alternative (regex-only validator, no IDN/DNS) scoring ~60% constraint saturation vs original 90%. Delta=30 → normalized=60. A regex-based approach could meet the letter of most requirements.
notes.minimalism: 53.6% — 340 LOC is substantial. RFC 5322 compliance, IDNA encoding, DNS fallback, IPv4 literals, frozenset of 40+ disposable domains — comprehensive but heavyweight relative to the 7 explicit constraints.

notes.naming: 70% — PascalCase constants (DISPOSABLE_DOMAINS, ValidationStatus, ValidationResult) and Enum members (VALID, INVALID_FORMAT, etc.) in SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE reduce the snake_case ratio vs the rate limiter.
notes.layer_consistency: Clean pipeline: split → validate_local → validate_domain → disposable_check → dns_check. Each step is a discrete method.
notes.error_unity: 100% — all errors appended to ValidationResult.errors list. Single consistent error accumulation pattern throughout.
notes.conceptual_unity: LLM: single paradigm — dataclass result + Enum status + OOP validator. Consistent use of Optional[str] returns and bool success flags.

analysis.why_partial: Inevitability (70.4) fails the ≥80 threshold. Minimalism (53.6) is the main drag — 340 LOC and comprehensive features go significantly beyond what the 7 MUST constraints strictly require. Alternative Delta (60.0) shows simpler regex-based alternatives could satisfy most constraints.
analysis.what_passes: Recognition (80.5) barely passes — 100% completeness compensates for 50% purity. Coherence (80.6) passes — error_unity=100 and clean layer separation offset the naming penalty.
analysis.source: Generated by Kilo Claw (OpenClaw Agent via Telegram) from 7 explicit requirements. Real end-to-end integration test. Comparison with rate_limiter shows different NON_CONVERGED/PARTIAL profiles for different domains.
analysis.improvement_path: To reach CONVERGED: scope INTENT.md to match what was built (add RFC 5322, IDN, DNS, IPv4 as explicit MUST constraints), or remove the _validate_domain IPv4 path and dns fallback if not needed. Aligning the intent to the code raises both purity and minimalism scores.

reproducibility.note: Real LLM run — generated by Kilo Claw, validated by Magnus 15. python convergence_validator.py examples/email_validator
